newsitem.title: BOSNIA: Croatian crowd attack Moslems in Mostar - radio.
newsitem.headline: Croatian crowd attack Moslems in Mostar - radio.

text.p: Angry Croats, supported by local police, attacked a group of Moslems who crossed into the western side of the divided Bosnian city of Mostar on Wednesday to try to repair their homes, state radio said.

The radio said the Moslems were beaten with sticks near their former homes in the Podhun area after they arrived from the Moslem-controlled eastern side of the E.U.-administered city in southwestern Bosnia.
A local television crew were arrested by Croatian police before European Union officials intervened.
An official of the Western European Union (WEU), which runs an EU police force, said contacts were under way with both sides to defuse the situation, but gave no further details.
"We have a tense situation between the east and west side," he said.
